title: Sound of the waves helps the appetite
text: We had several meals [and drinks] at Mariners and found the service to be good and the meals tasty and good value. Pretty standard beach front menu. I would recommend their Prawn Curry. The real attraction of Mainers is the relaxed ambiance one only finds on the beach.

title: not up to expectations
text:
We had noticed the lodge on several occasions and decided to stop over on our way back from the coast. First impression was good but the so called luxury two bedroom cottage did not live up to expectation. Rooms are cramped but a large bathroom. Unfortunately the shower was below standard. Not good value for the money.
The Bar has some unique wood features and the barman was helpful. Unfortunately the bar stools are extremely uncomfortable. Nice vibe overall.
We had dinner, my wife having the Chicken Pie while I had the Eisbein. Both were really very good.
It was raining at the time and the walk back to the Rondavel was unpleasant. Very poor lighting and we came close to falling on the uneven surface.
Unfortunately the noise from the N3 is very intrusive.

title: Not your usual Eisbein.
text:
We were a group of four for dinner. Setting overlooking the lagoon created a peaceful relaxed ambiance. All meals were perfectly prepared but I must make special mention of their Eisbein. Now, forget anything you know about traditional German style Eisbein because this was something special.
It was as if the Chef was given a challenge to prepare the Pork Shank in a unique way tossing aside the recipe book.
Its hard to describe but it was prepared in much the way one would slow roast a lamb shank; soft, delicious with unique herbs and spices yet retaining the crisp crackling.
Superb interpretation of a popular dish.

title: magnificent setting
text: Accommodation [three bedroom villa] was excellent. All rooms had their own en suite bathroom. Well equipped kitchen area and a large patio with braai facilities. The gardens and golf course are exceptional. We had breakfast/lunch at the Club house on several occasions and found the the food to be of a high standard and very reasonably priced.

title: These are 'wild' animals; not a Zoo.
text:
Sadly the tar roads have deteriorated even further with some rather deep potholes that could immobilise a vehicle. Overall still a wonderful wild life experience. Driver/tourist education really does need serious attention especially when it comes to blocking both sides of the road and not leaving escape routes; we are dealing with dangerous animals. At one stage a Rhino and her calf felt threatened by the cars surrounding her and she reacted by ramming our car.
It's hard to describe how powerful these creatures are and if she had not been dehorned we would have been in serious trouble.

title: such a pity that Covid has put a damper on things..
text: We arrive a little early and because of Covid regulations had to have drinks at the pool area while waiting to be seated. As a small group we had prawns, Kingklip and what I think was dorado as main courses. All cooked perfectly. The starters were tasty and the crumbed deep fried prawns were superb. Good service; enjoyable evening.

title: Impressive..
text: we dropped in for breakfast. Service was prompt and attentive. Our breakfasts were served without any delays and were exactly as requested. Surprisingly inexpensive for such a well run place. The view form the terrace is exceptional. Well worth a visit [or two].
place: The Gary Player Country Club Restaurant

title: Supposed to be 'the' eatery at Sun City Hotel
text:
We were a party of four during the week. We had booked but found the place was only partially full. Initial service was inexplicably on the slow side and we had to wait for drinks to arrive. Two ordered the half chicken peri-peri with a side of vegetables. The chicken was perfectly cooked and juicy and the vegetables done to perfection.
The order of oxtail was a bad mistake. Served without any form of gravy , dry and not adequately cooked.
The lamb curry, while really tasty, had too many poorly cut pieces of meat with sharp edges. I eventually caught the attention of the waiter and explained that the rice was cold. I was told "oh, I'll tell the chef".
We tried ordering more drinks and finally gave up and asked for the bill. It took nearly thirty minutes and arrived as we were about to walk out.
You cannot charge upmarket prices and pay so little attention to customer needs and expectations.

title: What Pilgrim's Rest used to be....
text:
Haenertsburg is a tiny village close to Magoebaskloof lined with several eateries and curio shops. There are a number of old wood and iron mine houses that can be rented. Unlike Pilgrims Rest you are not harassed by 'car guards' so strolling around the village is pleasant. The Iron Crown Pub was our choice as they serve a good craft beer called Zwakala. They serve some quite exotic Burgers and the smell of the curries being eaten at a nearby table had me salivating.
Clearly popular with visitors from the surrounding areas.

title: Magnificent setting
text:
The Hotel is one of those strange establishments we find hidden in out of the way places in South Africa. Old world charm, great pub, stunning views. We spent three days relaxing and visiting the area and could not have chosen a better place. Staff are old school, polite, attentive and genuinely proud of their Hotel.
It does have some faults. Bedrooms, while comfortable and clean, do need upgrading. Towels are past their sell by date.
Menu is good but a bit pretentious. The manager, Jayden, went out of his way to ensure that our stay was enjoyable and promptly attended to the few minor hitches we encountered.
Great place for a relaxing stay.

title: not up to expectation
text: We had read many favourable reviews visited Beaver Creek. The coffee, for which they are well known, is provided in self serve pump urns and did not do the various brews any justice. I personally don't like tepid coffee. Service was below par and the breakfast was bland and average at best.

title: Pity its not closer to home!
text: Amazing choice of home style delicacies displayed over a large area. You'll be really spoiled for choice. They seem to have sourced Jams, Pickles from all over the country. Price a touch on the high side but quality is apparent. They serve a very good breakfast. Efficient, prompt service. Highly recommended.

title: Old style country hotel
text: The Hotel is old and it shows; but that's part of its attraction. The Pub has the right welcoming feel as has the dining room. We have eaten there many times over the years and were disappointed on this occasion but hopefully this this was an aberration. The regular travelers who use the hotel as their pit-stop have created a unique atmosphere and the donkey that visits the Pub in the evening is a great focal point. Management and staff are friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful setting.
text:
We had a two bed roomed unit in Tortuga for a week and would definitely go back again. Comfortable, clean unit set in a very pleasant garden setting with access to a swimming pool. Furniture and TV need updating and unfortunately Wi-Fi is non existent. The estate gardens are immaculate and the walks to the river and the beach take you through the lush coastal foliage. Short drive to the Wild Coast Casino.
Staff , on all levels, were efficient and professional.

title: Probably the best in Port Edward
text: We ate there on two occasions and were impressed by the general 'feel' of the place and the good service. They have a Pub area, a dining area and an outside area with a wood fired Pizza oven. Food was good and inexpensive by City standards. Lamb curry was enjoyable but one of the peri-peri liver starters was a let down as it had a curry base. We had only one gripe and that was because the Pub area [which I favoured] allowed smoking. I queried this but it appears that smoking is condoned by management.

title: Grubby offset by excellent service
text: Pub that is clearly popular with the locals and an outside deck with a view. The young man who served us was really very good; attentive and helpful. I'm sorry I can't remember his name. Food is traditional "pub" style with generous portions. It's just a pity that their house-keeping is not up to standard. Scruffy fans and generally dusty and in need of a good scrubbing. They deserve a better rating.

title: Wish there was a rating for 'Good'
text: We enjoyed our visit and definitely would rate it as being 'good' but not deserving of "very good'. The upper deck requires placing drinks orders at the Bar so service can't really be rated. Good crowd and a pleasant family vibe. Meals are served on the deck but after a few drinks we opted to eat downstairs. The toilet facilities on the deck need sprucing up. Service was prompt and efficient and the 'jumbo' hake lived up to expectations. Worth visiting.

title: Deck with views of the beach
text: Nice setting and while the place was not full it had a pleasant vibe. The food being served at around our table looked good and seemed to be well received by the patrons. That's the good side. We finally attracted the attention of one of the many waiters and asked for menus and drinks and were told that 'our' waiter would be with us shortly. And so it went. Service was abysmal and what should have been a pleasant lunch time turned into a disaster. Possibly the worst service we had on the South Coast.

title: GREAT OVERVIEW OF ATHENS
text: The best way of getting a general 'feel' of the City. Recommend that you study the route map before hand so that you know the stops at the points you find interesting. Would give an excellent rating but for two faults. 1. The sign writing on the windows obscures the view and 2. the sound system was inaudible.
place: City Sightseeing Athens & Beach Riviera Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour

title: more of a baggage carrier..
text:
The airline allows 23KG in economy plus carry on luggage. We have never seen so many passengers blatantly carrying oversize luggage and forcing it into the overhead load areas. The crew allowed some passengers to put bags under the seats!
The seats were cramped and on some of our flights had faulty adjustments. Cabin crew were surly.
Ground crew in Cairo were very rude and not at all helpful. We will rather pay bit more and select another carrier.

title: most beaches are private
text: We live in South Africa where paying to use our [magnificent] beaches is unknown so the European norm is alien to us. Fortunately the better Hotels have private sections of the beach allocated for their use. Warm,clear water with not a wave in sight.

title: one of those places that make you feel comfortable
text: we had drinks there on a couple of occasions and found the service very good and the whole overall 'feel' of the place welcoming.

title: Deserving of its 5* rating.
text:
we had a private suite with its own swimming pool. Absolutely stunning, immaculate, accommodation and idyllic views of the Mediterranean from your patio. Nothing better than a few drinks while soaking in the view.
The Resort is large so you will be faced with some walks not suited to the unfit. The place is very popular with Germans so expect to hear more German than Greek! The food, while served in a buffet format, is exceptionally good and varied.
We used the 'all inclusive' package and were more than satisfied with the overall deal. There is a private beach and a large pool area for the sun worshipers.
The manager, Giongos Grivas is efficient, polite and very hands on and while all the staff are really good I must single out Ewa on reception, Stamatis at the pool bar and Savvas at the bottom bar. They are superb.

title: Like the Pyramids; a must see..
text: magnificent structures but be aware that you will face long queues and the walk to the top is strenuous.

title: Good way to see Athens
text: The open top buses run every 15 minutes and operate on a hop on hop off basis. We did the old City/Acropolis route as well as the route running along the coast. Athens is a vibrant blend of old and new architecture and we were pleasantly surprised by the overall cleanliness. This is an inexpensive way of getting a feel for the overall City. Remember to book a day pass and take a hat; it's hot on top of an open bus!

title: ONE OF THOSE TRICKY ONES..
text:
The hotel isl situated inside a market so access is slightly awkward but certainly not a problem as some travelers have said. Clean, reasonably sized rooms, comfortable beds. Why do so many hotels persist in having small baths when a good sized shower is so much better? Good breakfast and while they do not serve other meals there are numerous eateries within the market area. The roof bar has spectacular views of the Acropolis but expect to pay higher prices for your drinks.
We travel for experiences so opted for a room overlooking the market. Incredible sights of public hard drug usage but did not impact on our safety. Wonderful fresh meat/fish market a quick walk away with great fresh sea food bistros at reasonable prices. Perfect hotel if you want to experience the old Athens.

title: Was one of my favourites..
text:
I've always had a high opinion of the Highlander but our recent visit changed my opinion. We placed an order for drinks while reading the Menu. Drinks did not arrive.Called another waitress who brought our drinks. We waited for nearly an hour for our food and in the meantime battled to get drinks served. The place was not very busy.
My wife's Highlander Pizza was tasty while my Eisbein was a total disaster.
I'd been supplied with one of those wooden handled serrated pangas that are popular in some steak houses. A power saw would have been more appropriate.
The Eisbein was totally overcooked and almost inedible.
The Manager was not particularly attentive. We left feeling let down.

title: Number 1 in Clarens
text: A superb, innovative and wide menu served by highly motivated staff. And I mean every word. The restaurant serves breakfasts and lunches with a difference. Food is well plated and served with flair. Highly recommended.

title: I felt uncomfortable...
text: The craft beers are of a high standard and the snacks, albeit pricey, of a high standard. Service is good and the place obviously has a good following. However, I felt the pictures supposedly depicting a Yeti type hominoid living in the area were inappropriate. Some were amusing but the one showing a Neanderthal 'caught on camera' at the local Police station was disturbing.

title: exceptional staff
text: The room was large and comfortable with a spacious bathroom. The owner and staff ,especially Gogo, were very welcoming and attentive. A few niggling faults were sorted out promptly and efficiently. Breakfast was good value. Limited WiFi and the TV is in need of upgrading. Good value overall.

title: A proper Pub atmosphere
text: Clarens offers very limited choice if you are looking to have a few drinks around a fire place in a proper Pub. The Grouse has managed to retain that atmosphere and makes for a pleasant evening. Worth visiting and conveniently situated.

title: Good food and service
text: One of the better restaurants in Clarens. Do remember to book in the evenings. The whole Peri-peri chicken was well cooked and flavoursome but I would suggest that they partially separate the joints to avoid messing all over the table. Calamari was good but the Trinchado was tough and lacking flavour.

title: Past it's best
text: The once large vibrant gallery dominated by the works of Johan Smith has been downscaled but is still worth a visit. A number of Elga Rabe's stunning works are on display.

title: Awesome, in the true sense..
text: We stayed in Clarens and overheard a group of tourists saying they had not visited the nearby National Park. That's like going to Rome and not seeing the Vatican. Take a slow drive and stop at the many demarcated view sites and rejuvenate your spirit. The views cannot be described; spectacular multi-coloured mountains and ravines. The Parks Board have recently done a great job of signposting the area but as usual, a few clowns have felt it necessary to write their names on the boards. The Vulture feeding station is a must see.

title: Popular with local families
text: reasonably priced family Italian restaurant with good service and reasonable prices. Those who had the Pizzas were complimentary and my wife and I enjoyed the well cooked flavourful past dishes.

title: putting it simply...
text: a scruffy drinking hole. Calling it a pub is misleading. Minimal furnishing and totally lacking in atmosphere.

title: very convenient location..
text:
The owner is a star. Professional, friendly and highly attentive. He reacted to several small hitches with alacrity and without prompting. Went out of his way to guide us to the best local pubs/restaurants. We had the upstairs bedroom with it's own large balcony. The rooms are small but have good clean linen and are kept spotlessly clean.
Ideally situated near to the ocean.

title: disappointed, initially but..
text:
We expected the Lodge to be on the banks of the Orange River so felt let down on arrival. This soon changed. Genuine old style Karoo farm ambiance. Lovely garden with shady trees. The rooms are a few metres from the reception area and have a 'good' feel; comfortable large beds with top class sheets and duvets.
Highlight was the Dinner served in the dining area of the homestead. Absolutely top class cooking and even though there were only a few guests we were served a 'buffet style' menu. Roast Karoo lamb, Bobotie, Chicken Pie and vegetables all with that unique farm kitchen flavour.
Prices are on the high side but the exceptional food and setting more than compensated.

title: English pub atmosphere
text: Small and well supported by the local "pommie' crowd so seating can be a problem. Good atmosphere and with typical pub food [eg Cottage Pie]. We enjoyed the repartee among the locals.
place: The Royal Oak Pub and Restaurant

title: We thought we did not need to book..
text: Being a midweek evening we were surprised that the place was fully booked. We went back two nights later [after booking] and were glad that we did. The bar keeper and serving staff were friendly and helpful. The food was very good in the traditional Mozambique style. Would recommend but do book.

title: wonderful architecture
text: great photo opportunity if you appreciate traditional Church architecture. Seems to be well maintained but unfortunately we could not get access. Totally dominates this little village.

title: Very good if you have a sense of the absurd...
text:
The Hotel featured in Deon Meyers dystopian FEVER novel and caught our interest. Very dated with some of the most weird decorations. A bicycle holding up the basin in the washroom?!. We loved it. Great atmosphere in the Pub with both dinner and breakfast tasty and well prepared. The couple who run the hotel are helpful and a pleasure to deal with.
While in Hanover take a short walk and see the huge Church that dominates the village.

title: The watering hole makes the stop worthwhile
text:
Convenient ablution stop. Staff are very pleasant and the food not bad. The fact that you can watch the animals playing around the watering hole while you enjoy your brunch is a major plus.
As a local I could be mistaken but I got the impression that the goods on offer to tourists were overpriced.

title: Not the standards if we want tourists to visit..
text:
Great setting overlooking the Valley of Waves. Good variety of beer on tap and generously portioned "Pub" food. The Pub is situated on the mezzanine level and access is via rather steep stairs with no hand rail.No excuse for shabby bathroom with broken taps and grubby tiles.
Biltong and Dry Wors are iconic South African snacks but the snack bowl was a let down. If we want tourists to understand our love of these snacks we need to serve the best quality available.
A reluctant 'very good' star rating but the setting is really good.

title: put it on your bucket list
text:
If you are into experiences you'll really enjoy this one. Seating and accommodation is limited so you need to plan ahead The hotel is a short distance from the town and you are immediately back in a different era. Evening canapes are served on the expansive covered 'stoep' with a view of the town's church steeple on the horizon.
The decor in the show area is authentic cabaret hall and all the guests were caught up in the atmosphere. Great dinner and a highly entertaining burlesque show. Mark is a concert pianist and it shows while Jaques is an entertainer of note.
We certainly will return one day.

.

title: if you have a soul...
text: You have to visit the Owl House. Nieu-Bethesda is one of the many places ignored by South Africans who are in too much of a hurry to get to their destination. It's out of the way but truly worth the effort. You need to take time to read the letters and documents relating to her tragic life. The statues will touch every emotion and one clearly feels that their creation is the result of a deep spiritual union between her and Malgas and the others who shared her vision.

title: Don't listen to the snobs; try it!
text:
Situated at the mouth of the Kowie river with a large large inside dining area and Deck overlooking the river and sea. Really good service on every occassion. Guido's offers good value and large portions of good food with no pretense.
Relaxing atmosphere and charming waitresses.

title: A must try..
text: parking is a little limited so I'd suggest you get there early. Very welcoming staff and really personal attentive service. Food was very good as only happens when you have a hands on Chef. Very pleasant evening .

title: Historic old building
text:
we passed during the day and asked if we needed to book for an early dinner. We were told yes but in fact the place was rather empty when we arrived. Interesting history so worth looking at the information on display. Drinks service was tardy.
Food was served and was rather average with the 'steak and beer' pie in particular being very salty. Perhaps we'll be luckier on another night.

title: Established in 1832
text: The Pub has that wonderful 'aura' that only comes with time. If you are in to chrome and glass, well, it's not for you. Very friendly staff, exceptionally good prices and great home style food is what it takes to stay in business for over a 180 years. Highly recommended. Try their Ben Koppen draught beer.

title: The perfect Hogsback experience..
text: We all have a mental picture of the area and the Kings's Lodge fits the image. Old fashioned charm and appeal. No fancy frills just warmth and good service. Vuyo in the kitchen and Zola in the pub are assets to the establishment. Fire place, cold beers and pleasant company while it snowed outside!

title: Outstanding.
text:
Graaf -Reinet is the type of Town we have all driven through without stopping. Next time do yourself a favour and stay over at the Drostdy. There are not too many overseas hotels that can match their standards. No expense has been spared and it shows. Every effort has been made to create and retain the old Karoo character and even just walking around the hotel precinct is a sensory delight.
Take a walk around the area if you enjoy architecture. The Valley of Desolation is a short drive away and worth visiting. No wonder we love our country!

title: off the beaten track..
text: and not well sign posted. Very rustic; I really liked the double bed suspended like a hammock in the back garden. The beers are good so what more could you want? Put on your list if you are visiting the Owl House in Nieu-Bethesda.

title: A Jekyll and Hyde experience
text:
We selected this hotel in the belief that it's tie in with the Hotel school would ensure good service. Hotel itself is in a beautiful setting on the banks of the Kowie river. Reception area, general decor and cleanliness are certainly up to its 4* rating. The staff [Trainees] are polite, well groomed and helpful.
I can only make an asumption but my gut feeling is that the instructors have current problems and are just going through the motions. How else can you explain the following?
Asked for a beer at the Pub and was told they had no glasses 'because the students break them'!
A glass was located but was hot to the touch. Was offered a wine glass.
My wife ordered a pot of tea and was told they served Rooibos ' because they did not keep Five Roses'
Was served meals on chipped crockery.
A student suggested my wife try their cake and when she accepted was told 'it's out of stock'
It took three days before someone in the kitchen was able to fry eggs to my satisfaction.
The list goes on and on numerous occassions we asked for the intervention of a Manager.
This never happened.
I must repeat that, generally, the students were most pleasant and helpful and were let down by management.

title: NEVER FAILS....
text: consistently good. Well prepared food and really pleasant and helpful staff. Try their lamb Curry; they have captured the unique "Durban" taste. In fact, we have never had a below par meal.

title: still below par
text:
Attractive decor with an interesting Deli incorporated into the entrance area. Good choice of imported and craft beers. That's the good news..
Eisbein [remember this is a German eatery] was cooked to a frazzle. The crackling, described as 'crisp', was black and inedible. Meat was dry. The sauerkraut was tasty but the vegetables could best be described as boarding school fare.
The German style Meatballs were tasty but also served with the overcooked vegetables. I asked that the Chef be made aware of my comments and received the Bill within seconds!

title: SAME PROBLEMS AS THE OTHERS..
text: I think all airlines are much of a muchness but there is one aspect that can be sorted out and that is the problem with hand luggage. Why allow inconsiderate passengers with very large pieces of luggage onto the plane? I have yet to see the rules being applied.

title: stunning architecture but...
text: Very impressive from the outside. Set in lovely gardens, the Temple Is well worth seeing but strangely the interior lacked all spirituality. One felt as though there is a show about to begin.

title: overwhelming colours..
text:
the wholesale market is huge and the masses of flowers on display overwhelm the senses. Walking through the crowded alleyways is an experience in itself. Don't get lost!
Unfortunately the scents of the flowers is overpowered by the local pollution. The view of the bridge and the Ghat itself is average. Worth a visit.

title: ORGANISED CHAOS
text: The open air laundry is normally viewed from the bridge but I'd recommend that you visit with a professional guide. It is mind blowing to see thousands [and thousands] of pieces of laundry being processed and emerging at the other end back with their owners. Our guide showed us the 'spin drying' areas [manual] and explained the codes used to mark the items. Many of the hotels and hospitals still use the laundry. The workers-men- work and live within the laundry confines and there is even a school. A genuine insight into the hard working people of India.
